item.title: E add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Anyway. I’m not allowed to watch TV, although I am allowed to rent documentaries that are approved for me, and I can read anything I want. My favorite book is A Brief History of Time, even though I haven’t actually finished it, because the math is incredibly hard and Mom isn’t good at helping me. One of my favorite parts is the beginning of the first chapter, where Stephen Hawking tells about a famous scientist who was giving a lecture about how the earth orbits the sun, and the sun orbits the solar system, and whatever. Then a woman in the back of the room raised her hand and said, “What you have told us is rubbish. The world is really a flat plate supported on the back of a giant tortoise.” So the scientist asked her what the tortoise was standing on. And she said, “But it’s turtles all the way down!” I love that story, because it shows how ignorant people can be. And also because I love tortoises." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: E add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: E add a quote by Zadie Smith
item.description: "But the problem with readers, the idea we're given of reading is that the model of a reader is the person watching a film, or watching television. So the greatest principle is, "I should sit here and I should be entertained." And the more classical model, which has been completely taken away, is the idea of a reader as an amateur musician. An amateur musician who sits at the piano, has a piece of music, which is the work, made by somebody they don't know, who they probably couldn't comprehend entirely, and they have to use their skills to play this piece of music. The greater the skill, the greater the gift that you give the artist and that the artist gives you. That's the incredibly unfashionable idea of reading. And yet when you practice reading, and you work at a text, it can only give you what you put into it. It's an old moral, but it's completely true." -- Zadie Smith

item.title: E add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "There is no exquisite beauty… without some strangeness in the proportion." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: E add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Speak when you are angry and you will make the best speech you will ever regret." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: E add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Art is rarely intelligible to the criminal classes." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: E add a quote by Zadie Smith
item.description: "Every moment happens twice: inside and outside, and they are two different histories." -- Zadie Smith

item.title: E add a quote by Jonathan Franzen
item.description: "Nothing got inside the head without becoming pictures." -- Jonathan Franzen

item.title: E add a quote by David Nicholls
item.description: "Just kidding' was exactly what people wrote when they meant every word." -- David Nicholls

item.title: E add a quote by Zadie Smith
item.description: "In a whisper he began begging for—and, as the sun set, received—the concession people always beg for: a little more time." -- Zadie Smith

item.title: E add a quote by Sharon Olds
item.description: "A family is a mystery." -- Sharon Olds

item.title: E add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "And presently I was driving through the drizzle of the dying day, with the windshield wipers in full action but unable to cope with my tears." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: E add a quote by Frank McCourt
item.description: "I say, Billy, what’s the use in playing croquet when you’re doomed? He says, Frankie, what’s the use of not playing croquet when you’re doomed?" -- Frank McCourt

item.title: E add a quote by Edward Gorey
item.description: "There are so many things we've been brought up to believe that it takes you an awfully long time to realize that they aren't you." -- Edward Gorey

item.title: E add a quote by Jon Stewart
item.description: "If you don't stick to your values when they're being tested, they're not values: they're hobbies." -- Jon Stewart

item.title: E add a quote by Gloria Steinem
item.description: "We've begun to raise daughters more like sons... but few have the courage to raise our sons more like our daughters." -- Gloria Steinem

item.title: E add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: E add a quote by Edward Gorey
item.description: "It's well we cannot hear the screams we make in other people's dreams." -- Edward Gorey

item.title: E add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Selfish, adj. Devoid of consideration for the selfishness of others." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: E add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The only way to get rid of temptation is to yield to it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: E add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "Activism is my rent for living on the planet." -- Alice Walker

item.title: E add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "What I think the political correctness debate is really about is the power to be able to define. The definers want the power to name. And the defined are now taking that power away from them." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: E add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "I suppose that one reason I have always detested religion is its sly tendency to insinuate the idea that the universe is designed with 'you' in mind or, even worse, that there is a divine plan into which one fits whether one knows it or not. This kind of modesty is too arrogant for me." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: E add a quote by Jean Rhys
item.description: "All of writing is a huge lake. There are great rivers that feed the lake, like Tolstoy or Dostoyevsky. And then there are mere trickles, like Jean Rhys. All that matters is feeding the lake. I don't matter. The lake matters. You must keep feeding the lake." -- Jean Rhys

item.title: E add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Humans are the only animal that blushes, laughs, has religion, wages war, and kisses with lips. So in a way, the more you kiss with lips, the more human you are. And the more you wage war." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: E add a quote by Jon Stewart
item.description: "Religion is far more of a choice than homosexuality." -- Jon Stewart

item.title: E add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "Every day we're told that we live in the greatest country on earth. And it's always stated as an undeniable fact: Leos are born between July 23 and August 22, fitted queen-size sheets measure sixty by eighty inches, and America is the greatest country on earth. Having grown up with this in our ears, it's startling to realize that other countries have nationalistic slogans of their own, none of which are 'We're number two!" -- David Sedaris

item.title: E add a quote by Harryette Mullen
item.description: "I regret to say I'm unable to reply to your unexpressed desires." -- Harryette Mullen

item.title: E add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "He broke my heart. You merely broke my life." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: E add a quote by Amy Tan
item.description: "Isn't hate merely the result of wounded love?" -- Amy Tan
